SEARCH
Package net.xpkgclient.packagemanager

Class ExecutionContext

java.lang.Object
net.xpkgclient.packagemanager.ExecutionContext
public class ExecutionContext extends Object
This file stores variables and other environment data for execution of a script or the portion of a script.

    • ExecutionContext

      public ExecutionContext(File scriptLoc) throws IOException
      Create a default execution context.
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown if there was an issue creating the temporary directory.

  • Method Details

    • createBlankContext

      public static ExecutionContext createBlankContext() throws IOException
      Create a blank execution context for testing. Sets both script_type and package_type to OTHER.
      Returns:
      A new execution context.
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown if there was an issue creating the temporary directory.

      public File getResourceDownloadLoc()

      public void incCounter() throws XPkgInvalidCallException
      Increment the line counter by one.
      Throws:
      XPkgInvalidCallException

    • getLineCounter

      public int getLineCounter() throws XPkgInvalidCallException
      Get the current line counter.
      Returns:
      The current line of program execution.
      Throws:
      XPkgInvalidCallException

    • close

      public void close()
      Close the context and delete all temporary files.

    • getPackageType

      public PackageType getPackageType() throws XPkgInvalidCallException
      Get the package_type of the execution context read from the script head.
      Returns:
      The package_type of the execution context.
      Throws:
      XPkgInvalidCallException - Thrown if the execution context is closed.

    • setPackageType

      public void setPackageType(PackageType type) throws XPkgInvalidCallException
      Set the package_type of the script after reading it from the script head.
      Parameters:
      type - The package_type of the script.
      Throws:
      XPkgInvalidCallException - Thrown if the execution context is closed, or if the package_type has already been set.

    • getScriptType

      public ScriptType getScriptType() throws XPkgInvalidCallException
      Get the script_type of the execution context read from the script head.
      Returns:
      The script_type of the execution context.
      Throws:
      XPkgInvalidCallException - Thrown if the execution context is closed or if the script_type has not been set.

    • setScriptType

      public void setScriptType(ScriptType type) throws XPkgInvalidCallException
      Set the script_type of the script after reading it from the script head.
      Parameters:
      type - The script_type of the script.
      Throws:
      XPkgInvalidCallException - Thrown if the execution context is closed, or if the script_type has already been set.

    • setVar

      public void setVar(String name, XPkgVar value) throws XPkgInvalidCallException, XPkgImmutableVarException
      Set a variable.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the variable to set.
      value - The instance of an XPkgVar to set the value of the variable to.
      Throws:
      XPkgInvalidCallException - Thrown if the execution context is closed.
      XPkgImmutableVarException - Thrown if name is an immutable variable.

    • getVar

      public XPkgVar getVar(@NotNull @NotNull String name) throws XPkgInvalidCallException
      Get a variable.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the variable to get.
      Returns:
      The instance of an XPkgVar which was set using setVar(String, XPkgVar) or setInternalVar(String, XPkgVar). Returns null if the variable is not set.
      Throws:
      XPkgInvalidCallException - Thrown if the execution context is closed.

    • hasVar

      public boolean hasVar(@NotNull @NotNull String name) throws XPkgInvalidCallException
      Check if a variable exists.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the variable to check for existence.
      Returns:
      True if the variable exists.
      Throws:
      XPkgInvalidCallException - Thrown if the execution context is closed.

    • checkExistingVar

      @NotNull public @NotNull XPkgVar checkExistingVar(String varName) throws XPkgInternalException, XPkgInvalidCallException
      Check if a variable exists, and get it if it does.
      Parameters:
      varName - The name of the variable to check for existence.
      Returns:
      The variable, if it exists.
      Throws:
      XPkgInternalException - Thrown with the message "invalid" if varName is invalid, or it's thrown with the message "undef" if varName is valid, but this execution context does not have a variable with the name. Any time this exception is thrown its data will be of type String which will hold the name of the variable that was invalid.
      XPkgInvalidCallException - Thrown if this execution context is closed.

    • printContext

      public void printContext()
      Print all execution context data to System.out.
